description: From French gymnosophiste, from Latin gymnosophistae, from Ancient Greek γυμνοσοφισταί (gumnosophistaí), from γυμνός (gumnós, “naked”) + σοφιστής (sophistḗs, “sophist”).

entries.meaning: One of a school of ancient Indian ascetic philosophers, reported in antiquity, who wore little clothing; a mystic.
examples: As that gymnosophist in Plutarch made answer to Alexander (demanding which spake best), Every one of his fellows did speak better than the other: so may I say of these causes […].
